parameters: Thank you. There's not a ton to see, but feel free to look around.
I'm not sure I've been in a two-story house with only one bedroom.
I won't bore you with the details, but the original floor plan was different.
The closet doors run floor to ceiling. I wonder if it's a walk-in.
You would certainly fit, but I ask that you please not try to.
The closet doors run floor to ceiling. I wonder if it's a walk-in.
You would certainly fit, but I ask that you please not try to.
There's some paper and colored pencils in here.
Do you have any other art supplies?
Would you mind if I drew for a bit?
I haven't been able to focus in a while, but I kinda feel like I could right now.
Not at all. Would it distract you too much if I were here?
No. I like talking while I draw. Two tasks is a good amount of things for my brain.
My attention is better when it’s split.
Oh. I cannot draw to save my life.
When was the last time you drew?
Hm. \|Whenever the last time my grade in class depended on it was. Middle school, maybe.
Give it a shot. If you hate it, you don’t have to again.
Plenty at the office, but none here. Would a large book be all right?
Yeah. As long as it's hard and flat, I'm not picky.
Are you sure you wouldn't prefer to work at my desk?
I just sit weird when I draw. I have the best leverage with my knees up like this.
Nah. Because your headboard is mounted, I'd just push your mattress away from the wall.
Don't worry. I'm comfortable this way.
It's convenient that you're left handed.
The way the clinic is set up, it's easier for me to reach and work with people's right arms.
Oh! Yeah. I'm surprised you noticed.
You were writing with your left hand when you filled out the intake form that first week.
Otherwise, I would have used the needle on and bandaged your left arm.
Since the vein we draw from is right in the crook of the elbow, we try to use the non-dominant arm, if possible.
Huh. I guess that's something you would pay attention to, then.
They tried to "fix" me in elementary school.
Tied my left hand behind my back, slapped it with a ruler if I used it.
Then...\.\. I don't know. They just got off my back about it at some point.
Never explained. Never apologized. Just gave up.
I mean, I always had more pressing academic problems.
I was failing no matter which hand I held my pencil in.
But how they handled that kind of feels like an analogy for a lot of the "help" I got in school.
You gotta move your hand to draw something, Lee.
Whatever you want! That’s the whole point.
Anything you want to see.\.\. Anything your heart desires.
And what is that for you?
I wish I had been born as something else. Something wild.
I’d feel so much better as...\.\. I dunno...
A bee working hard with other bees to build our shared hive and raise our young.
Or as a rabbit foraging in winter to feed the babies in our burrow.
Even if I didn’t live long, at least I’d live knowing what I was supposed to do.
I’d be part of a larger system of others instinctively on the same page as me.
I’m not cut out for single-family, single-car, eight-lane-freeway life.
It feels like I’m not cut out for being human at all.
When I think about other ways of existing, I just feel this inner sense of peace.
When I think of my body and my brain being configured differently...
Having instincts that help me thrive instead of whatever self-sabotaging garbage my mind is doing to me now.
No. You answered my question very well.
May I see what you drew?
Everything I draw could equally be me, the artist, and you, the viewer.
\|But, yeah, you could say it’s you.
Have you tried to sell your art?
A little bit. I can’t stay organized enough to do business stuff by myself.
C'mon. I showed you mine. Fair's fair.
I cannot see pictures in my head.
I can’t imagine why you would want to.
I mean, you barely draw. That makes this super rare.
And you made it. It’s special for that alone.
Well...\| I can kind of understand that angle. Okay.
\|I want yours, then, too, if that’s on the table.
But, yes, you can have it.
Thanks for humoring me. I won't make you do it again.
No. If you enjoy it, I'm open to it.
It's impressive to watch you work so quickly.
And sorry for laughing at your shrimps. I like them.
There's an abalone shell, a conch shell, and a butterfly in the case.
The morpho butterfly is my father's work. It's over a decade old.
It's really pretty. I guess they can last for a long time, huh?
Preserved specimens can keep for hundreds of years.
This one won't, since I'd rather display it than store it properly.
I'm the same way with art. I wanna keep it where I can see it.
There's an abalone shell, a conch shell, and a morpho butterfly in the case.
I see a blue leather KJV on the top shelf, too.
Eighth birthday present, or baptism present, really.
There's some minerals in this display case and some books on the top shelf that say "DSM."
The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders.
That’s a box set of the DSM-I through the most recent edition, the DSM-IV-TR.
Oh. Is that when they revised it to take out being gay as a mental disorder?
No. That happened between the DSM-II and the DSM-III.
Although the DSM-III had to be revised in the DSM-III-R to remove “ego-dystonic homosexuality” for good.
Ego-dystonic homosexuals being erased yet again...
They also took out “masochistic personality disorder” at the same time.
Damn. Well, maybe they like being invalidated like that.
There's some minerals in this display case and the DSM box set on the top shelf.
The bed looks comfy. Is it a... queen? No.
You're close. It's a California King.
Like many of my belongings, it is a hand-me-down from a family member.
It's kind of fitting that it's from California.
Because it's, like, an annoying and unnecessary version of a preexisting concept, and yet it got popular.
It certainly limits my bedsheet options.
Asking the employee in the linens section if they "have anything in California King" is degrading.

I'm not sure I've been in a two-story house with only one bedroom.
I won't bore you with the details, but the original floor plan was different.
Could I take a bath at some point? Doesn't have to be right now, but...
Yes. Just give me a chance to clean it first.
